page.title: 06Rookley Village and Clubs
page.content: There are about 240 people living in the 53 houses in our Survey area of north Rookley. The village was given Parish status in l984. With two new housing estates there has been consid- erable growth in the past 20yrs. There is a Residents Soc., Village Show Soc. W.I., Mother's and Toddler's Club as well as Football and Table Tennis Grps The school was closed in l958. Primary children travel to Chillerton whilst Middle and High pupils go to schools in Newport. {Phillip Martin writes:}My Mum is the leader of a Beaver Colony at Godshill for local boys 6-8 years. This is the start of Scouting. Later we become Cubs and then Scouts at 11. Girls can belong to the Brownie Pack and to the Guides at Chillerton. After that both boys and girls can become Venture Scouts.
